title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
02:05 <abusenius> has quit  
03:26 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:01 <Denis> has quit  
07:09 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:24 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <vmassol> has quit  
08:00 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <Denis> has quit  
09:30 <vmassol> good morning  
09:30 <vmassol> continuing my test spree today  
09:33 <vmassol> tmortagne: I got a tweet from sonarsource  
09:33 <vmassol> they're moving their nemo setup for xwiki from svn to git  
09:33 <vmassol> they said: "@vmassol x-commons 3.1-SNAPSHOT can not be found in x-rendering because master is 3.2-SNAPSHOT"  
09:33 <vmassol> do you know what they mean?  
09:34 <vmassol> hmm I haven't checked does it mean x-rendering is using x-commons 3.1-SNASP  
09:34 <+tmortagne> well what they say is true but it's also obvious so I don't see why they say it  
09:34 <+tmortagne> no the say the opposite ?  
09:34 <+tmortagne> checking  
09:35 <+tmortagne> indeed someone forgot a task when creating branches  
09:35 <+tmortagne> fixing that  
09:35 <vmassol> ok thanks!  
09:36 <+tmortagne> editing files directly in github is a nice feature :)  
09:36 <+tmortagne> done  
09:36 <vmassol> cool  
09:36 <vmassol> I'll let them know  
09:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: wait  
09:37 <vmassol> ok  
09:37 <+tmortagne> every branches have the same mistake...  
09:38 <+tmortagne> s/branches/projects/  
09:38 <+tmortagne> fixing all of them  
09:38 <vmassol> k  
09:38 <+tmortagne> wondering why we did not seen that  
09:38 <vmassol> yeah  
09:40 <+tmortagne> don't know who created the branches  
09:41 <vmassol> maybe cjdelisle?  
09:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: let me know when I can tweet back  
09:42 <+tmortagne> ha it's done sorry  
09:42 <@cjdelisle> what did I break with branches?  
09:42 <@cjdelisle> There are some branches left over from the last release I have not deleted, are those the ones you are talking about?  
09:43 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: all the parents version were wrong in master branches  
09:43 <+tmortagne> they were all set to 3.1-SNAPSHOT  
09:44 <@cjdelisle> ahh indeed, I didn't update anything to 3.2 on the master. since I was working from branches it slipped my mind  
09:44 <@cjdelisle> sorry about that  
09:45 <vmassol> the sonar guys noticed it for us ;)  
09:57 <vmassol> btw I should have finished the upgrade to sel2 RC2 by the end of today is all goes allright… (I started yesterday)  
09:57 <vmassol> I'm fixing tests one by one  
10:00 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <@cjdelisle> hmm I have a class file which is twice the size of the java file it was "compiled" from  
10:11 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <+tmortagne> nice  
10:15 <+tmortagne> I guess some complex language shortcut can produce lots of bytecode  
10:16 <@cjdelisle> it has a lot of text in it, all class names are fully qualified  
10:18 <@cjdelisle> ahh bad example  
10:18 <@cjdelisle> it's been tinkered with by the datanucleus enhancer  
10:20 <@cjdelisle> it seems most of them compress down the about 80% original size  
10:21 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we really want to be spammed by contrib projects on the notif list?  
10:23 <vmassol> I think we're already receiving too many emails  
10:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you mean jenkins only or github too ?  
10:23 <vmassol> jenkins  
10:23 <+tmortagne> well this is a GSOC project it's not like any contrib  
10:23 <vmassol> the github emails have more value  
10:24 <vmassol> it's a contrib like any other  
10:24 <vmassol> gsoc is exactly the same  
10:24 <vmassol> as we agreed on our gsoc page btw….  
10:24 <+tmortagne> not exactly since we actively follow it  
10:24 <+tmortagne> any other contrib we don't reallt care much  
10:24 <vmassol> we treat them as any ormal contributor  
10:24 <vmassol> in any case  
10:24 <vmassol> if  
10:25 <vmassol> we want to set up a ci for them I think it shouldn't send to the main lists  
10:25 <+tmortagne> i'm not sure it's possible to not send mail project by project in jenkins, checking  
10:26 <+tmortagne> ok disabling it, anyway I don't really look at mail for jenkins so that does not change much for me  
10:26 <vmassol> that's what we want to change :)  
10:27 <vmassol> (that people look at jenkins mails and trust them)  
10:27 <+tmortagne> I look at jenkins directly very often anyway  
10:28 <+tmortagne> actually i'm putting chamika's mail for this project  
10:28 <+tmortagne> since he should know about it  
10:28 <vmassol> sounds good  
10:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <+tmortagne> looks like something changed with m2Eclipse in indigo I could not just reuse the same .metadata, had to reimport all maven projects...  
10:40 <vmassol>  nice...  
10:40 <vmassol> ahah rc3 is out… going to try it (sel2)  
10:41 <vmassol> it's supposed to support FF5 I believe  
10:41 <+sburjan> cool  
10:57 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <@sdumitriu> enterprise-tests still hangs  
10:57 <vmassol> yes  
10:57 <vmassol> "normal"  
10:57 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: The object property fix didn't help, it seems  
10:58 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: it just supposed to make it less called but does not fix the real issue  
10:59 <@sdumitriu> I know, there are two bugs at play  
11:00 <vmassol> my test changes are making some tests hang  
11:00 <vmassol> I'm finishing the fixes today  
11:00 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: did you found something in lucene plugin ?  
11:00 <vmassol> well actually today I couldn't find hangs yet but just slow tests  
11:00 <vmassol> since when you use findElements it waits the max time  
11:00 <vmassol> ie 10 seconds  
11:00 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Didn't have time to look yet...  
11:00 <+tmortagne> ok  
11:01 <+tmortagne> will try to find some time to reproduce locally  
11:03 <+tmortagne> plus try to improve the plugin property modification by not reintialazing already initialized plugins, should fix whatever any plugin is doing wrong on that  
11:03 <+tmortagne> wondering If I will not reopen my thread about simply removing that :)  
11:06 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: another possibility is flushcache, i think some plugins like Lucene plugin are reinitialized when flushcache is called  
11:07 <+tmortagne> instead of just... well flushed  
11:07 <+tmortagne> " GC overhead limit exceeded" on ci platform build  
11:08 <+tmortagne> I don't think i ever seen that  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> hehe I broke java  
11:08 <@cjdelisle> Segmentation fault      /usr/local/lib/jdk1.6.0\_21/jre/bin/java  
11:08 <@sdumitriu> Looks like someone is eating memory  
11:12 <@cjdelisle> hmm that's interesting  
11:13 <@cjdelisle> stupid mistake which should have caused a regular stack overflow segfaults the vm  
11:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <vmassol> (debugging InvitationTest)  
11:39 <+sburjan> so I'm not the only one :P  
11:40 <vmassol> sburjan: you're workong on those too?  
11:40 <+sburjan> vmassol: nop, but once I tried to understand them too .. some time ago  
11:55 <vmassol> I really don't get it  
11:55 <vmassol> some findElements() are fine and just wait the implicit time  
11:55 <vmassol> while some other hang forver  
12:07 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <vmassol> has quit  
12:10 <@cjdelisle> when I sleep I'm going to dream about chickens and eggs  
12:10 <@sdumitriu> Another build hanged for no reason, this timpe on tests-3.1  
12:12 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: Can I trigger a printscreen on an agent?  
12:12 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
12:12 <@sdumitriu> Firefox seems to be using 100% CPU while nothing is happening in Java  
12:13 <+sburjan> FF usually goes to 100% CPU because of JS especially 3.6 version  
12:17 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: I'm pretty sure it must be becuase of the findElements issue  
12:21 <@sdumitriu> Still, how do I trigger a printscreen?  
12:27 <vmassol1> printscreen when?  
12:27 <vmassol1> if you're modiyfing a test you can do this:  
12:27 <vmassol1> getUtil().takeScreenshot()  
12:28 <vmassol1> but this is already done in most places  
12:28 <vmassol1> when an error happens  
12:29 <@sdumitriu> Nu, in real time  
12:29 <vmassol1> then I have no idea  
12:29 <vmassol1> if it exists it must be a feature of xvnc probably  
12:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <vmassol1> has quit  
13:16 <+mflorea> guys, I see BaseClass (from old core) has defaultViewSheet and defaultEditSheet. They make sense for a class (they point to a \*class sheet\*). There's nothing similar in XWikiDocument right? I can't find it and I wanted to be sure.  
13:18 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: am I right?  
13:23 <abusenius> has quit  
13:26 <@sdumitriu> Right  
13:26 <+mflorea> thanks  
13:33 <Denis> has quit  
13:38 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you there?  
13:38 <vmassol> got a question  
13:38 <vmassol> I see this in a test:  
13:38 <vmassol>             getGreenMail().waitForIncomingEmail(2000, 2);  
13:39 <vmassol>             MimeMessage[] messages = getGreenMail().getReceivedMessages();  
13:39 <vmassol>             Assert.assertTrue("Messages were received when they shouldn't have been sent!", messages.length == 0);  
13:39 <vmassol> the first line waits for 2 messages right?  
13:39 <vmassol> but then 2 lines below we expect 0 messages to have been received  
13:39 <vmassol> I don't understand....  
13:40 <vmassol> unless the waitForIncomingEmail is expecting the timeout to happen  
13:41 <vmassol> in which case I don't understand why we're waiting for 2 messages....  
13:41 <vmassol> maybe waitForIncomingEmail(2000, 0) doesn't work?  
13:41 <@cjdelisle> oh yea  
13:42 <vmassol> i'm debugging it because I receive 2 messages when I run the test  
13:42 <@cjdelisle> that's embarassing but you can't "wait for nothing to happen" so I wait 2 seconds and if nothing happens call it good.  
13:42 <vmassol> hmm why are we allowed to send messages at all?  
13:43 <@cjdelisle> which test is it?  
13:43 <vmassol> testUnpermittedUserCannotSendToMultipleAddresses  
13:43 <vmassol> the send button could report and error instead no?  
13:43 <@cjdelisle> indeed it should  
13:43 <vmassol> I see "your message has been sent" in the browser  
13:44 <@sdumitriu> Hm, on IcedTea JVM there's a hang with 200% CPU when trying to stop Jetty  
13:45 <vmassol> cjdelisle: this is what I see: http://tinycoke.com/\_6rYBvzopN8XHA/screen\_shot\_2011-06-24\_at\_1.44.41\_pm.png  
13:45 <@cjdelisle> does it say what the username is?  
13:46 <vmassol> NonMailAdminUser is mentioned in the scrneeshot  
13:46 <@sdumitriu> Guys, I'm changing the mysql settings in hibernate.cfg.xml  
13:46 <@cjdelisle> err is the user "NonMailAdminUser"  
13:46 <@sdumitriu> Switching to MySQL5InnoDBDialect instead of MySQLDialect  
13:46 <vmassol> fyi I'm on a breakpoint just where we assert that we've received 0 message  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> And removing the sql\_mode setting from the connection string, since it doesn't work with mysql-connector-5.1.16 and isn't needed with the 5InnoDB dialect  
13:47 <@cjdelisle> looks like a bug ofc I don't understand how bugs just appear out of the blue in the untouched invitation code  
13:48 <vmassol> I have it locally and when running 2.0RC2 (sel2)  
13:48 <vmassol> maybe it doesn't happen on jenkins  
13:48 <vmassol> would be good if someone could confirm it  
13:53 <@cjdelisle> if I git pull and run will it be using the new version?  
13:53 <@cjdelisle> 2.0RC2  
13:53 <vmassol> no  
13:53 <vmassol> I haven't committed it yet since I want to finish verifying all etsts  
13:53 <vmassol> but here I doubt it has anything to do with RC2  
13:53 <vmassol> and I want to upgrade to RC3 after I finish the tests on RC2 (since it's now out)  
13:54 <@cjdelisle> I just tested with the old version and all tests pass  
13:54 <@cjdelisle> InvitationTests  
13:55 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: what will happen when the database has been created with default engine ? the dialect force innoDB to be the engine ?  
13:55 <@cjdelisle> what's the RC2 version named?  
13:56 <@cjdelisle>       <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>  
13:56 <@cjdelisle>       <artifactId>selenium</artifactId>  
13:56 <@cjdelisle>       <version>2.0RC2</version>  
13:56 <vmassol>     <dependency>  
13:56 <vmassol>       <groupId>org.seleniumhq.selenium</groupId>  
13:56 <vmassol>       <artifactId>selenium</artifactId>  
13:56 <vmassol>       <version>2.0rc2</version>  
13:56 <vmassol>       <type>pom</type>  
13:56 <@cjdelisle> ^fails  
13:56 <vmassol>       <scope>test</scope>  
13:56 <vmassol> wrong version and you must add the scope  
13:56 <qwebirc42866> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: It won't change the engine of an existing database, but there's no problem with using a different dialect  
13:58 <+tmortagne> so usiing MySQL5InnoDBDialect when the engine is not innoDB will work without any issue ?  
13:59 <+tmortagne> "this can also be done on our side by specifying that we prefer the InnoDB engine" seems to indicate that it will automatically change the engine on mysql server  
14:00 <@sdumitriu> Yes, it will work  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> that test passed but later on it hangs  
14:00 <vmassol> yes "ormal"  
14:00 <vmassol> normal  
14:00 <vmassol> (the hanging)  
14:00 <@sdumitriu> The only difference between the two dialects is the engine type used when creating the database, and the mapping of some column types, again used when creating the tables  
14:01 <vmassol> cjdelisle: ok it passed too now  
14:01 <@sdumitriu> There are no runtime differences in queries  
14:01 <@cjdelisle> why is it hanging? obviously it's not acceptable in production  
14:01 <vmassol> I've cleaned my DB  
14:01 <vmassol> since I had run tests several ties on ot  
14:01 <vmassol> seems to be related to initial conditions  
14:02 <@cjdelisle> well I'm about to hit the hay, highlight me if you have any other questions today.  
14:05 <vmassol> ok thanks  
14:06 <vmassol> hmm I ran the test a second time with the same DB and it failed now again  
14:07 <vmassol> (cjdelisle)  
14:08 <vmassol>             // Prove that the user can now send to multiple recipients.  
14:08 <vmassol> that must be why it's working thereafter  
14:09 <vmassol> makes sense now  
14:09 <vmassol> I'll try to fix it  
14:14 <vmassol> fixed  
14:14 <vmassol> fixing the hang now  
14:18 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <vmassol> cjdelisle: seem like you forgot that junit has assertEquals() :)  
14:50 <siert> has joined #xwiki  
14:50 <vmassol> you've used assertTrue(xx.equals(yyy))  
14:50 <siert> hello  
14:50 <vmassol> fixing some of them  
14:50 <siert> I've problems exporting my complete wiki to a XAR  
14:50 <siert> unpacking the XAR results: java.io.IOException: /xwiki.onvz/local/xwiki/bin/view/IT+Applicatiebeheer : could not create directory  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> Hi siert  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> Well, that sounds like an unzip problem with directory names  
14:51 <@sdumitriu> Try to list the files first  
14:51 <siert> don't work either  
14:52 <siert> i'll give it a try on windows aswell, moment  
14:52 <+tmortagne> not sure it's an unzip issue actually, I think when there is export issue it produce invalid zip  
14:52 <siert> the export finished without warnings  
14:53 <@sdumitriu> Yes, but it shouldn't report "could not create directory"  
14:54 <siert> indeed, that's when i 'jar -xvf' the archive manually  
14:54 <siert> jar -tvvf xwiki-20110624.xar -> does list everything correctly  
14:55 <siert> it does contain a strange file though...  
14:55 <siert> 3755 Fri Jun 24 14:38:52 CEST 2011 //xwiki.onvz/local/xwiki/bin/view/IT+Applicatiebeheer/Howto.xml  
14:55 <siert> the rest of the archive are normal (allowed) filenames  
14:57 <qwebirc42866> Good Morning All. I had a quick question, how can i specify a parent when using velocity to create a new page?  
15:02 <qwebirc42866> Just using this example: #set ($mydoc = $xwiki.getDocument("MySpace.MyPage")) $mydoc.setContent("test") $mydoc.save(), didn't add the MySpace as the parent for me.  
15:04 <+tmortagne> $xwiki.getDocument("MySpace.MyPage") get you the document in the space "MySpace" and with name "MyPage", not sure what you expect it to do  
15:04 <+tmortagne> by default a document does not have any parent  
15:07 <+tmortagne> qwebirc42866: document parent is not automatically its space. Parents are actually an alternative organization compared to spaces  
15:07 <qwebirc42866> there is no way to specify the parent there?  
15:07 <+tmortagne> yes , the exact same way to specify the content  
15:07 <+tmortagne> setParent("somepage")  
15:10 <qwebirc42866> ah I see, thank you very much. Im testing it out now. Appreciate your time.  
15:10 <+tmortagne> note that MySpace is not a page if you want the space home page to be the parent you need to use MySpace.WebHome  
15:10 <+tmortagne> qwebirc42866: you'r welcome :)  
15:12 <qwebirc42866> Okay I will keep that in mind. Thanks!  
15:14 <+tmortagne> git expert: what is the clean way to move the modification I made directly to the master (I really need to do something about this bad reflex) in a new branch (like if I did it the right way in the first place) ?  
15:15 <vmassol> isn't that automaitc?  
15:15 <vmassol> when you git checkout?  
15:15 <vmassol> oh you've committed them already?  
15:15 <+tmortagne> nop  
15:16 <+tmortagne> but evrytime I  did a checkout with modification it told me that it was forbidden but it was when checkouting existing branch  
15:16 <+tmortagne> lets try  
15:16 <vmassol> -m maybe  
15:16 <vmassol> (if you have conflicts)  
15:17 <siert> A user created a page with the name "local/xwiki/bin/view/IT+Applicatiebeheer/Howto" in the Space "//xwiki.onvz"  
15:17 <siert> Is there a way to manually delete this page?  
15:17 <siert> from out of the document index it fails  
15:17 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I want a new branch, i'm not switching to an existing one  
15:19 <+tmortagne> but -m seems nice for other use case I had  already  
15:23 <+tmortagne> hmm actually -m could do it, since the branch is created from HEAD and the when actually doing the checkout we ends up in the exact use case defined by -m option  
15:24 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: thanks for the hint, here is what I did  
15:27 <+tmortagne> git branch mybranch  
15:27 <+tmortagne> git checkout -m mybranch  
15:27 <+tmortagne> does not seems to work directly with  
15:27 <+tmortagne> git checkout -m -b mybranch  
15:27 <vmassol> ok  
15:39 <arkub> has quit  
15:40 <qwebirc42866> Hey again, sorry i have one more quick one for you guys.  I would like to use a specific template for the new page being created. This: $mydoc.setContent('$xwiki.getDocument("TestTemplate.TestTemplate")'), isn't working, just adds text directly to the page.. Thanks!  
15:47 <qwebirc55398> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <qwebirc42866> has quit  
15:57 <qwebirc55398> sorry had internet issue.  this is qwebirc42866, with the question on including a template when creating a new page in velocity.  Thanks.  
15:57 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <vmassol> :)  
16:00 <vmassol> qwebirc55398: you can use / nick your-name-here  
16:04 <siert> Importing large XAR files (250MB) is not the way to go. What's the alternative way to migrate from Oracle to MySQL?  
16:07 <qwebirc55398> :)  
16:12 <joyWiki> has joined #xwiki  
16:15 <+tmortagne> siert: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+Wiki+Export  
16:16 <+tmortagne> and then http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Large+XAR+Import  
16:16 <+tmortagne> with that you should be able to export/import a wiki of any size  
16:17 <siert> tmortagne: nice, thanks!  
16:17 <+tmortagne> it just limited by the size of the biggest attachment in your wiki for the export  
16:18 <+tmortagne> import one is loading the whole page in memory but still better than the whole xar  
16:19 <siert> the code is run through an xwiki page?  
16:24 <+tmortagne> siert: yep  
16:24 <+tmortagne> you have to copy past it in a xwiki/1.0 page  
16:24 <+tmortagne> put that is a protected space ;)  
16:25 <siert> very nice ... like this method even more :)  
16:25 <+tmortagne> the reason why it's xwiki/1.0 and not 2.0 is that this should be script need to be usable from very old wikis  
16:25 <siert> it's working hard :)  
16:25 <siert> ah, makes sense  
16:25 <+tmortagne> and I was too lazy to do several version ;)  
16:26 <siert> don't care, like this a lot...thanks man :D  
16:27 <+tmortagne> np, this should be the default export and import :(  
16:29 <siert> jep, it should  
16:30 <venkatesh> has quit  
16:30 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:30 <siert> thx, i got to go... having a beer :)  
16:30 <siert> cya!  
16:31 <siert> has quit  
16:34 <abusenius> has quit  
16:35 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:35 <@sdumitriu> qwebirc55398: If you want to set the same content as the one in another document, try:  
16:36 <@sdumitriu> $mydoc.setContent($xwiki.getDocument('TestTemplate.TestTemplate').getContent())  
16:36 <@sdumitriu> But that won't copy other things from the template, like the parent or any objects attached to the document
